children.title: Agent Registry & Discovery
children.description: A central service where agents publish capabilities and can be looked up for reuse and composition. Enables interoperable multi-agent systems.

children.title: Agent Orchestration
children.description: Coordinating tasks across multiple agents or tools with planning, scheduling, and error handling. Provides control flow for complex, multi-step automations.

children.title: Agent SDK + templates
children.description: Developer kits and starter templates to build, test, and deploy AI agents with tool use, memory, and safety. Accelerates standard patterns and best practices.

children.title: MCP Registry & Discovery
children.description: Discovery layer for Model/Capability Providers so agents can dynamically find tools and skills at runtime. Supports extensibility and governance.

children.title: Memory Management
children.description: Short- and long‑term storage for agent context, facts, and summaries to maintain continuity across sessions. Powers personalized and stateful behavior.

children.title: Agentic RAG
children.description: Agents decide when and how to retrieve, verify, and iterate over external knowledge to complete goals. Improves robustness on multi-step tasks.

children.title: Model Catalog
children.description: An inventory of available models with versions, metadata, policies, and usage guidance. Simplifies selection and governance.

children.title: Foundation Models
children.description: Large pre-trained models adaptable to many downstream tasks via prompting or fine‑tuning. Provide strong baselines for generative use cases.

children.title: Model Gateway
children.description: Unified control plane for accessing and governing multiple models/providers with routing, auth, and observability. Reduces integration and compliance burden.

children.title: Dynamic model routing
children.description: Automatically select the best model per request based on cost, latency, capability, or content. Optimizes quality and spend.

children.title: Semantic Cache
children.description: Cache responses by semantic similarity to avoid repeated LLM calls, lowering cost and latency. Requires vector similarity with eviction policies.

children.title: Document Parsing
children.description: Extraction of structure and text from PDFs, Office docs, HTML, and images for downstream processing. Handles tables, figures, and layout.

children.title: Document Analysis & OCR
children.description: Optical character recognition and document understanding to convert scans into machine‑readable text and entities. Critical for enterprise content.

children.title: Chunking
children.description: Split documents into semantically coherent passages optimized for retrieval and context windows. Improves precision and grounding.

children.title: Vector Storage
children.description: Databases for high‑dimensional embeddings with fast similarity search for RAG and semantic features. Supports filtering and hybrid search.

children.title: Advanced RAG: reranking, hybrid
children.description: Enhancements like cross‑encoder reranking and dense+lexical hybrid retrieval to raise recall and faithfulness. Often boosts answer quality.

children.title: Text 2 SQL
children.description: Natural‑language to SQL translation over governed schemas for analytics and automation. Requires schema grounding and safeguards.

children.title: Observability & Tracing
children.description: Monitoring prompts, model calls, costs, and latencies with request traces and metrics. Supports debugging, governance, and optimization.

children.title: Prompt Ops & Repository
children.description: Versioned storage and workflows for prompt design, testing, and rollout. Enables collaboration and safe iteration.

children.title: Evaluations incl. dataset creation
children.description: Systematic evaluation using curated datasets and metrics to measure quality, safety, and drift. Essential for regression and A/B testing.

children.title: Prompt Optimization
children.description: Techniques and automation to improve prompts for accuracy, cost, and safety, e.g., self‑reflection and rewriting. Can be manual or programmatic.
